snippet: The Council of Europe’s ruling, a symbolic one, has revived a debate in France, which forbids physical discipline in schools but not in family settings.
abstract: Council of Europe rebukes France for failing to ban corporal punishment of children as it agreed to do under European Social Charter; charter has revived debate in France over parents' right to discipline children.
lead_paragraph: The Council of Europe’s ruling, a symbolic one, has revived a debate in France, which forbids physical discipline in schools but not in family settings.

headline.main: France Is Rebuked Over Corporal Punishment by Parents
headline.print_headline: France Is Rebuked Over Corporal Punishment by Parents
